item.title: Black Families Are Leaving New York. Can a Pastor’s Plan End the Exodus?
item.description: In the East New York neighborhood of Brooklyn, a pastor is devoting his time to building affordable housing for his congregation.

item.title: Ukraine’s Drone Strike on Russia Aims to Change Putin’s Calculus
item.description: Kyiv’s attack on the country’s bomber fleet appeared designed to show Russia’s leader that continuing the war carries big risks for Moscow.

item.title: Ukraine Says It Struck Crimea Bridge
item.description: It would be the third such attack. The claim comes two days after one of Ukraine’s most ambitious operations of the war, deep inside Russia.

item.title: A surprising trick to making hard choices: Try thinking less
item.description: The tactic may seem counterintuitive, but it can help you make tough decisions faster and with more confidence, says decision coach Nell Wulfhart.

item.title: Jacinda Ardern, New Zealand’s Former Prime Minister, Pushes Kindness in New Book
item.description: The former prime minister, who led New Zealand through the pandemic, has published a memoir arguing for more empathy in politics.

item.title: Live Updates: South Korea’s Opposition Leader Likely to Be Next President, Exit Poll Shows
item.description: The campaign of Lee Jae-myung, a center-left candidate, rode a wave of anger against Yoon Suk Yeol, who was ousted for imposing martial law.
